turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need to schedule a follow-up appointment.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I can help with that. To get started, please tell me who the appointment is for, which doctor you need to see, and the general reason for the follow-up.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's for me, Emily Carter. I need to see Dr. Rodriguez in Cardiology for my post-op check-up.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you, Emily. Let me check Dr. Rodriguez's availability for a cardiology follow-up. The earliest I see is Friday, November 10th at 2:30 PM.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: November 10th? That's over three weeks away! My surgeon said I should be seen within two weeks of discharge. That timing doesn't work at all. Why is it taking so long? Can't I get in sooner or see someone else in the practice?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your concern about the timing, Emily. Dr. Rodriguez is quite busy. The November 10th slot is the very first available opening his schedule shows for follow-ups. Unfortunately, our system prioritizes seeing the original physician. Seeing someone else would typically require a new referral, which can sometimes take longer.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That seems ridiculous. So my only option is over three weeks out with him, or start a whole new referral process which might take even longer? There are no cancellation lists or other doctors with any earlier openings at all for a simple follow-up?
